runs.comm: over the wicket, on a length and there's a hint of inswing as Wright closes the face, works one past midwicket
again this comes back, Hales is a little stuck in the crease and gets an inside edge on to his pads, the ball just dropping past leg stump
pitched up in the channel, swings the arms and chops a bump ball into the hands of cover point
full and wide again, steered this time down to third man
short of a length, on the hips and nurdled behind square for a couple
pitched up around off stump, big backlift from Wright but he doesn't connect cleanly and gets just a single wide of mid-on
length ball in the channel outside off, Wright plays a watchful leave. Lovely
fuller, around off stump, comes forward and taps into the covers
NCN is up at 88mph, tight line in the corridor, Wright steers straight to point from the crease
bit of width, Wright swings hard but fails to connect, might have bounced a tad more than expected
is that a drop? Replays suggest it might have been, Coulter-Nile certainly thinks so, Wade fumbling a low take to his left as Wright got a thin edge down the leg side trying to glance off his hips
and he cashes that cheque, denying the bowler a maiden with a scooped four down the leg side from a short delivery on the stumps
fired full and wide of the stumps... too wide
pitched up, outside the line of off, squeezed to point as Hales chops down on it
goes for the inswinging yorker, gets enough bat on it to squeeze one through backward point
quick and in the channel outside off, another swing and a miss from Wright
gets away with a full toss, on the stumps and hacked back down the track, Starc collects in his follow through and the scorers mark a dot

drops short, pulled... straight to deep square leg! So Wright gets another single-figure score, despite moving up the order, he was in position to play the shot, went aerial but can't have been looking at the field. Cutting did a two-step to his right and then settled for the take
full, attempted yorker, I think, slides down the leg side, flick of pad and it beats Wade's dive
slightly short of a length, follows the batsman, who plays it on to his body aiming to leg
driven on the up just over extra cover, first boundary for Hales, got enough on it and cleared the infield

now Hales has picked out deep square leg, this time on the run! Sweetly timed, a little pick-up swivel pull, but not enough to clear the boundary, there is only one man out there but he made good ground and England lose both openers in similar fashion
shuffles across and plays a length ball into the off side
off-stump line from Coulter-Nile, Root again plays watchfully with a straight bat
gets across and defends a length ball square on the off side - another cracking over from Coulter-Nile, keeping the pressure on
pushed through flat outside off from round the wicket, Stokes makes room to swing a cross-batted drive through the covers for four
angled in, worked wide of mid-on for one
flat, on the stumps, turned to midwicket
tossed up, pushed back to the bowler's right, Maxwell doesn't completely stop it but mid-on prevents a run
full and wide of the stumps, Root mows across the line, gets a bottom edge that bounces over the stumps, past Wade for one

heave ho, off he goes, a loopy leading edge caught on the edge of the ring! Stokes laid the dynamite but only succeeded in blowing himself up, swinging hard and falling harder, the ball looped towards point and Cutting took an excellent catch back-pedalling
pitched up outside the line of off, Root chops into the ground towards point
on the stumps, pushed back on the up to mid-on
drags this short and Root plays a orthodox pull, flat and in front of deep midwicket, where Muirhead gets to it on the slide but only manages to flip the ball beyond the rope for four
bit of width, opens the face and steers one to third man
length ball on off stump, pushes at it and in inside edge runs short and square on the leg side for one
goes back and cuts hard, it's stopped well at backward point and then Morgan has to throw himself back to regain his ground at the other end
darted outside off, comes forward and chips a couple over the infield towards deep extra cover
tossed up and punched down the ground on the front foot
floated up on the stumps, Root tries reverse-sweep and is hit on the pad, possibly a little glove saves him, as the umpire turns down Maxwell's appeal
full on the stumps, conventional slog-sweep attempted this time and the ball misses everything, they run a couple
pushed across from round the wicket, runs a single to short third man
skips forward to a full ball and boings it over wide long-off! Such power in those wrists, the bottom hand coming through as a mere punch soars beyond the boundary for England's first maximum
on the stumps, dabbed into the off side
gets forward and pushes this through the covers for a single
goes round the wicket, Morgan moves outside the line and plays an audacious scoop over fine leg! Clever batting and that's six more
goes fuller, still outside off, squeezes one in front of square
touch short, Root swats it aggressively down the ground for one
Morgan leaves the crease and clumps one to long-on for another single

oh dear, Cutting has had a mare here, moving round the boundary at deep cover to stop a drive, he slides past it, makes the pick up and then somehow manages to toss it on to the rope, unable to pull it back in slow motion with a groping hand
comes forward again and drills one to long-off
pushed through on leg stump, nurdles a couple through backward square
on the stumps, sweeps flat but picks out midwicket
opens the shoulders, can't force the ball into a gap on the leg side

off balance and launched into the sky towards deep midwicket, where Cutting is under it again! Root's labours are over, a knock that was scratchier than a pair of woollen undercrackers, scooped to leg and again nowhere near clearing the boundary rider
full and worked to leg, midwicket cuts it off
gets forward and punches a full delivery towards mid-off, turns down a tight single
short and at the batsman, who top-edges a pull, into a gap at square leg for one to get Buttler off the mark
short and wide down the leg side as Morgan swings and misses
stays back in the crease, settles for a a dabbed single through square
adroitly done by Buttler, a legcutter from Cutting and he waits on it before flicking a ramped four over the head of Wade. England need <del>a few</del> <del>several</del> lots more of those
tries again, this time scoops and misses
tossed up and slapped over the covers for another boundary, Morgan moving smoothly through the gears
Maxwell scampers to the leg side to field off his own bowling
on the stumps, played back to the bowler
on the charge, swings and edges but it bounces in front of short third man and Morgan lives
comes forward and punches a single to long-off
flat, worked into the leg side and they want two, Maxwell again chases after it but Morgan makes it home, good running
length on off stump, worked into midwicket, just for a single
length outside off, slapped down to long-off
slower ball, back of a length on off stump, Buttler heaves it down to long-off
full, angled in, Morgan tucked up and struck on the pad which runs towards cover and the bowler fields
Morgan steps to leg, Christian follows him and Morgan flicks it around the corner for a single

length ball, Buttler steps to leg and heaves over the on side but not far enough and he holes out to Maxwell at cow corner, simply not enough bat on that trying to clear the longest part of the ground
length on the stumps, flicked through square leg and the fielder races in to save the second
pulled without timing down to long leg
Bapara steps back and flicks from off stump to short third man

length ball swung to leg, Morgan doesn't get all of this, in comes Starc from deep square leg, dives forward and takes the catch but of course when it's close, which this is, they will go upstairs to have a check and there's every chance this could be overturned but thankfully not because the catch looked clean. A fine take in fact, very sharp work, as has been all of Australia's fielding
short and pulled off the splice of the bat, no-one at square leg so gets away with this for a single
short again, better pull but straight to deep-square
excellent yorker dug out into the covers
clears the front leg and swings backward of square, there's a fumble and they get back for two
length ball struck frimly wide of long-on and Finch simply can't be bothered running to his right, a lazy one hand and he misses the ball completely
huge swing and a thick inside edge to long leg

huge swing at a full ball, gets a huge inside edge into his pad and it trickles slowly into leg stump and that is a very unfortunate way to go. The ball cannoned of the inside of his pad and agonisingly rolled steadily towards the stumps, glanced the base of the leg stick and off dropped the bail
blocked on the back foot in front of off stump
tossed up, Bresnan ends up trying to late cut off the stumps and almost misses, gets a bottom edge to slip on the bounce
nice stride down the wicket and hammered down the ground, strong shot

swing outside off, misses courtesy of the turn, Wade has the bails off and there's a strong appeal for a stumping and Wade was sharp to remove the bails as Bresnan dragged his bag foot a good two inches out of his ground and fails to get back in time
tries to paddle sweep from outside off and misses
shorter, flicked around the corner to deep-backward square who's very fine
floated up on off stump, driven off a thick outside edge to backward point
back of a length, angled to backward point and they get a sharp single
bumper, well-directed, Jordan misses with a hook
full angled in, Jordan gets struck on the pad squared up
full and swung, missed completely, it goes past leg stump
short and gets a bat on this, manages to get it backward of square and finds the gap
swing and a miss at a full ball again, it grazes leg stump again
length ball, Broad goes back to try and pull, misses and loses middle stump some sharp turn on that, Broad beaten all ends up and has to go. Nicely bowled
back to cut or pull or smash it anywhere, he missed
full toss outside off, smashed almost to mid-on, it just doesn't carry
floated up outside off, driven nicely on the up and gets it wide of mid-off, well timed
turn away from off stump, swung at, hit on the toe into the covers
swung from off stump, it whirls off a thick outside edge towards deep point
full at the stumps, aims leg side and gets a thick edge into his pad

short outside off, pulled into midwicket, Dernbach wants to come back for two, whoopsie! It's never on and he's run out by a street trying to scramble back to the striker's end and that's a calamitous end to a truly horrendous tour for England
